website_summaries.verdict: A good-looking soft-sided gun case that does not look like a gun case.
pros: Includes a padded shoulder strap, which allows you to wear on your back
Nice storage pocket to secure scopes or other accessories
This case comes in various sizes to fit your needs
Comes with Velcro straps to secure your firearm in the bag
cons: Front compartment zipper doesn't open far enough to lay the bag down flat

customer_reviews.title: Case was just what I was looking for and seems well made.
customer_reviews.text: This case is just what I was looking for. I bought a Ruger PC carbine 9mm which is a takedown so this bag is perfect. It seems to be very well made and well designed. It has room for ammo, magazines, any other range needs. It has pouches for large AR-15 or AK-47 magazines but they are just the right size for three 50 rounds boxes of 9mm. The 25" case comes with six felpro straps for securing the rifle. I have read some negative feedback on the zippers not starting easily and I found that if I grab the "D" ring next to the zipper and pull out slightly the zipper moves freely.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mcmullen

customer_reviews.title: Does fit 2 16" barrel carbines
customer_reviews.text: This is an awsome case especially for the price. I have 4 magazines of 7.62x39 and 4 magazines of 5.56. A spot for my CZ p07 with case and second magazine. Speed loader and a bunch more boxs of ammo all in the secondary pouch. Also it DOES fit 2 carbines 16" barrel barley depending how small your red dot sites are. For big magnified scopes good luck with that. I overlapped the handles underneath the barrel of the other.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Inconspicuous Case
customer_reviews.text: This case is killer. I show it to my friends and they are like what do you have in it? "Scary things the government probably doesn't want me to have" :) Really low key and scary black tactical things don't imprint into the fabric either! The straps provide unlimited configurations to store lots of items. Front pocket is great for storing 30 round magazines (if you are lucky enough to still legally have them in your state...God Bless the South). Good job UTG! I love your scopes and I love this case!!! It could hold several handguns or possibly even an AR pistol, a 9MM, several magazines (six 30 rounders by my measurements), and a tactical flashlight.
customer_reviews.author: Choose901

customer_reviews.title: I didn't think I'd like it but do...
customer_reviews.text: For the cost I wasn't expecting much but am pleased with what I received. I doubt I'd put 2 carbines in it but I might a couple of SBR's or AR-pistols. I like it's ease of use and double zipper...some only have a single zipper which I really don't like. I have some better quality cases too and while I'd not compare them to those, I think this was a good valued case. Reasonably priced, securing straps, storage, and reasonably well stitched & made. I'd recommend it to a friend no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Larry B

customer_reviews.title: Slick case
customer_reviews.text: Needed a solid case for a dual purpose AR build with 2 uppers, one of which is a 24" barreled grendel upper with a high power scope. After doing some research, I decided this would likely be the best bang for my buck. I'm really glad I chose this case. It holds everything very securely and has plenty of storage for mags, cleaning supplies and miscellaneous stuff. Padding is more than adequate and the backpack straps are a really nice touch if you're carrying a lot or hiking into a spot.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Simple design.
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to carry without being too conspicuous. There aren't many that look discreet. Thats is why i choose the utg bag. Discreet lookinh bag.. easy to high in the bag of the car. Slim enough to be hidden behind the car seat. Quality and material is OK. Not that heavy duty... the zipper could use a bit more expanding in the bottom corner to accommodate thicker contain. But overall is a good bag.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great range bag but Vertical grip's a NO GO
customer_reviews.text: honestly this thing has great storage space for the most part. You can see from the pictures of the front storage compartment 3mags but it can hold 4. Full size holster for CZ P-09Sr and plenty of pistol mag space or another pistol(CZ P10s pictured) and a speed loader. My only gripe is the main rifle compartment won't accommodate two rifles unless you meet certain criteria ie..no vertical grips just AFG bipod or barrier brace. Two verticals will overlap and mar your rifle, just not enough bag top to bottom. Plus my Sig will only fit with a 20" match barrel if I fold the stock but otherwise a standard(16")AR with collapsing stock should work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Cig Sour 522

customer_reviews.title: Very  Pleased with it and it's worth the price, Very
customer_reviews.text: Love Everything about it so far.. It's well made and you can tell that UTG takes great pride in their products and survive. update, I load this up with a pistol and several magazines, 2 heavy rifles with several loaded 30 round magazines, and I travel with it almost every week and it's holding up great so far, also the outside of the case is easy to wipe off and get rid of any pet hair, the pet hair thing might be minor but I like my guns to look nice and the carrier also, I guess it's pet peeve but seriously keeping the case looking good is important to me.
customer_reviews.author: SECRET SHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for me, but a very good pistol bag
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent multi-gun case. The only reason I knocked it down is that I was looking for a bag for my HK 416 .22LR SBR (legally considered a "Pistol"), and the loops for mags in the side pocket won't accommodate the Walther/Umarex mags. It was made for pistols. I do like it, so the downgrade is from my PERSONAL need, not any less quality for what it is designed (multi-pistol). Will give it to a friend who is tired of carrying several smaller bags. If it had mag loops big enough for the .22.LR mags, I'd keep it happily.
customer_reviews.author: R. Overall

customer_reviews.title: Utg home land security covert "25
customer_reviews.text: This case is sweet. A lot of people say it's hard to fit carbine ar15s or that you can't fit them,but I bought the "25 and its perfect. I also own the bulldog covert case I paid twice for and this case is 3x better. Worth every penny and got free shipping took 6 days
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great Rifle Bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good case for the price. I needed to secure some rifles I had at the time of purchase in 2017 but sold them. This case protected them from scratches and humidity. I believe this one was the 36" so it fits the standard 16" barrel ar15 and the front slot can store up to (3) magazines. The main compartment come with fastenings to secure it in place so it doesn't move around. Keep in mind that if your muzzle brake and/or stock is longer than the standard then I reccomend a larger bag, I think they go up to 42".
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Good budget bag, strap system holds securely but has its limits.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a 34" to house an M&P 15-22. Fits perfect length wise. Mags fit a bit strange in the small pocket, but I found that the fit in elastic bands just fine. I'm not in love with the strap system, it takes some effort getting them situated correctly and you can't mount any horizontally (diagonally is a bit difficult too), but there are enough straps to still provide a secure hold. The shoulder strap is a bit odd as the mount points are at the middle of the bag ends, so I'm limited to carrying in vertically on my shoulder. Not the worst thing, but would have liked the option to have a more comfortable mount to carry horizontally.
customer_reviews.author: ffej101

customer_reviews.title: FITS RDB AND AR TOGETHER.
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for something for your RDB this is it. It even fits in the smaller front pocket. Standard 16 inch AR fits in the back pocket with the stock collapsed. Optics should fit as long as it's reasonable for that platform. And both rifles can be in their pockets at the same time. Padding is reasonable for standard range carry. Don't do the Samsonite test with it. (For those that remember those commercials.) It will protect being loaded into your vehicle for your trip. Straps and handles are strong. Always remember the price point. It's not a pelican. But it is a great value and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Better than good enough!
customer_reviews.text: A great simple bag for my Kel-tec RDB17. Fits with just a little bit extra room, if I decided to add a suppressor. Seems well padded, but if you have a NICE optic, you might consider a bit of extra padding around it, I'm not sure how good it would protect with a significant drop. Worth every penny! But if I had any complaint it would be that the velcro straps for binding the rifle itself could be a tad longer, or come with extras. They almost don't close well over thicker parts of the rifle.
customer_reviews.author: a guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent general duty bag.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bag for S&W M&P 15-22. Way more Velcro tie down straps than needed, but if carrying pistols would come in handy. 25" model will have about 1/2 inch on each side of upper, so it fits well inside of bag. Plenty of room for lower. Have not abused bag, and all zippers are still working fine - no rips or malfunctions. Purchased over 1 year ago, and very satisfied with bag. May not be suitable for "real" AR platform rifle - check dimensions of upper & lower before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Josephine

customer_reviews.title: Great Practical Carrier/Case for your AR-15
customer_reviews.text: I have a classic Colt M4 LE6920 5.56. It just fits. This is an affordable, regular, and functional carrier/case. This is a low profile, light, and inexpensive general purpose carrier for your AR-15. The padded case interior offers BTS webbing and several hook and loop straps that offer many possible ways to configure and secure the contents. Additional exterior zippered pouch offers 4 magazine pockets that can hold eight -30 rd magazines and additional BTS webbing to provide many more carry options. You can spend much more and not get something as practical. I wouldn't call this a 'hard use' type case. (I am a casual shooter and don't find myself camping or in bad weather etc..)
customer_reviews.author: Mister Blue

customer_reviews.title: Absolute best case for the money.  Ar with mag&optic installed and still zips closed
customer_reviews.text: I'm one of this weirdos that search for days and read endless reviews even when buying something simple and cheap so I know own I'm getting the best bang for Buck. This case is one of those things. Item description is spot on and you won't find a better case for the money. It holds my 16" AR(fully collapsed stock), with installed 30 round mag and EOTech/magnifier and zips closed. This way all you have to do is reach in and your ready to go. Couldn't be any happier
customer_reviews.author: Cody P.

customer_reviews.title: ... Kel-Tec Sub 2000 G2 and Taurus Millennium G2 9mm like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Fit my Kel-Tec Sub 2000 G2 and Taurus Millennium G2 9mm like a glove. The MOLE style straps allow you to customize the layout for your gun and magazines. Three large pouches fits a pistol(s) and storage or 3 AR-15 Mags. The quality of the bag is pretty good for the price. I'm very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rexpo

customer_reviews.title: Great case for my bullpup shotgun
customer_reviews.text: I researched cases for the ATI Bulldog bullpup shotgun and settled on this one. It seems to be perfect. No issues fitting the bullpup (it has a dot site on the rail and the sights sit very high). The front pocket is perfect for 5 rd mags (small pouches) as well as 10 rd mags (bottom of the pocket). I'm also able to fit some tools and ammo with no problems. Definitely recommended for a bullpup!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Manzella

customer_reviews.title: Fits my needs well
customer_reviews.text: Good choice for a bulpup gun. Fits mu KSG with a few inches to spare in the main compartment. The padding is ample for a trip to the range. The Velcro loops allow for a lot of flexibility securing the items - a well thought out system. The side compartment is roomy with three dedicated mag pockets. I use them for 5-packs of shotgun ammo. I am not sure how "Covert" this case is but it is good choice when you don't want the full-length rifle bag.
customer_reviews.author: kirills

customer_reviews.title: Well Made but....
customer_reviews.text: The pictures are deceptive. The shoulder strap is useless. It is attached in the middle of the back side. You can't practically carry the bad with anything in it with the should strap. It is positioned badly for where the weight is distributed in the bottom of the bag laterally. The bag really needs end loops on the top sides and clips for the shoulder strap. Then it would be a 10.
customer_reviews.author: Sundance

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect - Sig Sauer MPX fits like a dream!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this case to hold my Sig Sauer MPX and I couldn't be happier with it; construction seems nice and solid, and the design is brilliant. Plenty of Velcro loops (placement is adjustable) to hold the gun steady in the main compartment, just the right amount of padding and space for my purpose. The red dot sight gets closer to the top of the case than I'd like, but in my situation, this case is actually more for storage than transport. The front compartment easily holds four 90 gram CO2 cylinders (the big ones), my extra magazine and three more magazine belts. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: PG_302

customer_reviews.title: A quality tool, that is good looking.
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed case with many compartments inside of various size and holding capabilities and styles. I was surprised at how much case and of good quality material I got. When I go with any gun I take this along even if the gun is carried in a separate case because I've gotten used to so many accessories this case allows me to have on hand I can't do without it. It is very smart looking and actually looks like it would be holding a large wide screen laptop. Sturdy velcro tie downs in main storage compartment insure no gun movement.
customer_reviews.author: BroMark

customer_reviews.title: Kel Tec KSG
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this case for my Kel Tec KSG. I really love the adjustable straps inside the main compartment. The adjustable straps allowed me to fit my KSG, along with the optic mounted. The case has more of a laptop material kind of look, rather than a tactical one. Some may not like it, but I do. I also love the smaller side compartment, which allows me to place ear plugs, ammo, or tools specific to my Kel Tec. Overall, I think this is a great case, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Fits an M4. And a little more.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a rifle case for my M4. I wanted something that would fit it in but also something that wouldn't bulk too much. The 25" case caught my eye because I it had another zipped up compartment you can fit magazines in. It fits 3 M4 magazines, a 1911 pistol and 2 1911 magazines. One thing I feel that I have to mention is that if you have a scope it may be a little hard to be able to tight the velcro straps. Also I have a typical rear sight attachment and it was a little tough to zip the case close.
customer_reviews.author: Saul Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect range case for an AR Pistol
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little case (34" model). Perfect for transporting my AR to and from the range. Internal storage fits my 12.5" AR perfectly! Build quality feels great and durable. The external storage has 4 magazine storage slots that can hold 2 magazines each with elastic bands on the outside of them, so in theory it can hold a total of 12 magazines. It does make the case a little bulky, but it is possible. Also has plenty of room for spare ammo boxes and/or tools.
customer_reviews.author: Villalva

customer_reviews.title: Perfect case for my needs and fits my S&W M&P 15-22 perfectly. (34" version)
customer_reviews.text: This case is absolutely awesome. Quality materials, well padded, lots of adjustable interior straps, lots of pouches and it fits my S&W M&P 15-22 perfectly (34" version). I just bought my rifle but I'm confident it will fit all my accessories. I got this case because I live in an apartment complex that doesn't care about firearms as long as it doesn't alarm other residents. I needed something that didn't scream "gun". While you can obviously figure it out, it doesn't stick out as much as other cases I've seen. Extremely happy with this case. Phenomenal value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty good case for light duty use
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good case for light duty use. Its a UTG product so its probably best suited for airsoft use, but I thought I'd give it a shot (no pun intended). I carry a broken down SBR in it and it works OK but the case seems stretched and the zippers have a hard time zipping because of a pucker in the fabric at each corner that must be held just right to allow them to zip. Not big issues since its a lower end prodcut, but something I wouldn't expect at a higher point.
customer_reviews.author: fixedgearbiker

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Just recieved and was pleaseantly surprised on how well it was packaged it wasn't folded or creased anywhere. I ordered the 34" case for my s&w m&p sporter2 with a mid riser and a bushnell trs25 rds fit perfect. I have not field tested this case but will update with time. Great buy for the money. Also note that the 34" and under do not come with the backpack straps shown in the pictures only the 38" and up.
customer_reviews.author: Erick

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP PRICE, QUALITY PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Co complaints yet - it is new still, so we'll see how it lasts, but the size is perfect for my S&W MP15 - tons of straps inside, so you can hold down the firearm, magazines, tools...etc. Heavy duty, nice thick foam, double zippers. Outside pocket is huge, tons of room for more magazines, ammo, handguns...etc. So far pretty happy with this purchase, especially for the price point, it is definitely worth it, considering it is like the cheapest one.
customer_reviews.author: mitsuevors

customer_reviews.title: Functional Not Flashy
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a case to take my rifle to the range. At first the "tactical" looking bags appealed to me but then the practical side of me took over. This case doesn't have that !I'm an airsoft badass" look to it. It looks like it could be for some kind of musical instrument or something. I wish it had a few more internal pockets but so far it works exactly the way I need it to. I'll amend my review if if doesn't hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great value, very discrete.
customer_reviews.text: Love it, great case. Got the 36” model. Will hold an 9” barrel AR-9 and several pistols and mags. Can also fit a 18” barrel AR but have to separate the lower off. Very sturdy and the back sling is a very nice touch. Kind of looks like a flattened golf bag or a short snowboard case. About as unassuming as it gets for its purpose. Quality seems great, but it is a soft case, although decently padded.
customer_reviews.author: Preppa the Pig

customer_reviews.title: Had serious trouble with zipper
customer_reviews.text: I purchased is case because it had over 1,000 great reviews. So I don't understand why had so much trouble with it. I had the 38" size case. When the case is completely unzipped the folds in the corners made it very difficult to zip the case. I loved this case so I kept trying to figure out the trick to easily zip it up -- but never did. So I returned it. Finally, when a range manager order me to leave the bench with case unzipped, I decided it was time to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Albert J Cacace

customer_reviews.title: Fits my AR-15 carbine perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Good quality case that does exactly what I want it to do. The single shoulder strap is centered on the back of the case so the case will lay flat on your back when you wear the strap across your chest. Two D-rings allow you to attach your own strap to wear it on your shoulder. Zippers seem a little cheap but they haven't broken yet. Additional pictures will be provided
customer_reviews.author: Doug in Florida

customer_reviews.title: AR47 carbine with 16" barrel + 2" muzzle brake
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for rifle cause I was looking for something a little less bulky to take rifle to the range. I love it. The Velcro holds the rifle in well (I have it sitting diagonally). The Sling works well without getting in the way. Plenty of pockets for magazines and such and it fits in the trunk of my car. I would recommend this to a friend
customer_reviews.author: Mike & Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and it has back pack straps
customer_reviews.text: We'll build and good bang for your buck... I have my Ar-15 and Berreta in this thing. It's looks pretty and has back pack straps for when you need to take your guns on a long walk. My guns at much happier now that they get plenty of walks. All joking aside I really do like the back pack straps.
customer_reviews.author: Emanuel Cayetano

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Velcro straps can be moved where needed with ease to secure weapon in a position that keeps it from making contact with edges and adding further protection. Holds plenty of accessories to keep everything with the weapon. It's not a quick draw case, since the velcro would need releasing. The zippers could be sized bigger (my opinion), but I haven't had an issue thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Great value in a well constucted, well thought out gun case
customer_reviews.text: I got a new AR pistol. Needed a case but did not want to spend a lot of money. I figured I'll get this 39.00 case for now. It's not like I'm going trekking to Alaska this week. I am very pleasantly surprised. This case is very well constructed and customizable for your specific requirements. It has two compartments, one for your gun....or guns, (could hold two rifles) and one for accessories, mags, whatever. Can't beat it for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Peterson

customer_reviews.title: It’s got back pack straps for rear carry too
customer_reviews.text: What a nice padded case . I got the 42 inch one . Right now the 34 inch is sold out . I like the larger of the two . You would be surprise hod much you start loading it up with. It’s got a separate compartment for mags and things. Plenty of Velcro straps.
customer_reviews.author: JohnBoy’s

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, descret, case. Be confident
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Keltech KSG. So far, it works great. Plenty of room for it and my pistol. Velcro sraps and the storage pocket are perfect. You can put a lock on the double zipper, though I would not rely on that as your only security, but sufficient for prying eyes. So far, it seems very durable. Great option for the price.
customer_reviews.author: J. K.

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: For the money I'm satisfied. Everything is as stated and zipper seems like it will hold up. I wanted something that wouldn't alarm people when going from my house to vehicle and when I'm on the road traveling. Fits my 16" AR with standard A2 flash hider. If it was even a tad longer I'm afraid you would stress the zipper.
customer_reviews.author: Throop

customer_reviews.title: Shoulder strap unusable
customer_reviews.text: Someone needs to explain the shoulder straps connecting in the horizontal middle of the case. Other than that pretty decent. Would not be comfortable using this for more than 1 rifle and magazines. Can’t get a pistol in there without them threatening to smack into each other.
customer_reviews.author: Binkle

customer_reviews.title: Great Case
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is a nice Bag, it’s crazy padded and as you see it’s plenty big for my giant Hi-Lux Optic. The zippers are well made and thick with zero snags or hiccups and the storage area Jesus, I have 3 magazines a Bipod and small tool kit in there riding tight. I’m ordering 2 more of these for my Sons to replace there hard cases. Semper Fidelis
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality but kinda tight fit for carbines..
customer_reviews.text: It's very well made but my carbine barely fit. I had to take my custom muzzle brake off and go back to an A2 bird cage to get it to fit with the stock collapsed. Other than that no worries. If you're running longer than 16" barrel length or an A2 style rifle get the next size up. This is probably a better fit for an AR pistol or an SBR build.
customer_reviews.author: El Diablo

customer_reviews.title: 24"  UTG Gun Case, Dual Storage
customer_reviews.text: This gun case is just right for my Ruger 22 Charger and the extra magazines. The shoulder strap is interesting because it is mounted on the side of the case so that the case lays flat on your back when shoulder carrying. All the high quality velcro straps in the mail compartment allows for odd gun shapes and the pockets and elastic straps in both compartments make this bag very useful. I got the 24" version. I paid $36.09 with Prime and free shipping. I had considered several other cases not as nice and twice the price prior to finding this little gem.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great product with options just wish I could get a second one that’s longer
customer_reviews.text: I love the padding, fits 2 rifles without scopes and without mags but secure. Has place for mags, pistol + more pistol mags. One rifle with scope and 30 round mag would fit. I like because it makes me feel my firearms are protected while inside plus it’s not screaming I am a firearm because of the basic coloring. My only complaint is I could not find one in a longer size for longer rifle? I want another one, but longer; need it 48 inch or closer to 48 for a 308/243. 46 might work.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: I also have recommended it to others who enjoy shooting
customer_reviews.text: This is actually the second bag I have purchased from this line (for two different types of gun). Not only would I buy this again...I did! I also have recommended it to others who enjoy shooting. The soft lining in the gun section keeps your firearms safe for travel to and from the range. The front pocket has plenty of room for clips and other accessories and the thick straps in the gun section, hold your gun (or guns) in snugly Excellent product. Oh, and this large bag has padded straps on the back for easy carrying (like a backpack).
customer_reviews.author: LFB

customer_reviews.title: really like the bag M&P15 fits nicely. excepted one thing maybe 3 1/2 stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag, fits M&P 15 nicely. 2 AR might not fit to good. maybe 2 small rifles. Mags pockets fit 30 rd mags, stuck the 40 rd mag in the mag strap on the outside of the mag pockets Seem to be durable and well padded. the only problem is the velcro on the handles isn't sewn on correctly. one side is sewn in an angle so it miss over half of the velcro.
customer_reviews.author: Tom55st

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bag for simplicity
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a bag for my specific gun. I got one off ebay and the first time carrying it the cheap liner ripped completely out. This UTG bag is very nicely padded and simple. The velcro straps keep the firearm secured and are customizable. For reference I have a Remington 870 with 18.5 barrel and raptor grip. I was back and forth between the 32 and 34 inch but the 32 fit perfectly. Also I'm able to carry my Beretta 92 in its case, a Taurus G2C, and my wife's Taurus 38 I a soft case. I have a plastic tub for all my ammo, mags, and accessories,etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy construction
customer_reviews.text: Like the design and carrying options for the case. Bought it to transport my Keltec KSG 7 and pleased to see it will easily handle several pistols, mags, and small boxes. Basic but adequate sholder sling is appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl S. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Got it for a PC9
customer_reviews.text: I really like the storage compartments. I can carry boxes of 50 on the side pocket and my extra mags. All i need is this bag and nothing more to carry.
customer_reviews.author: JOOEEE!!

customer_reviews.title: Won't fine a better product for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This case has plenty of storage for guns and additional magazines, plus room for additional shooting items. I was absolutely amazed over the value and quality I received in this case in comparison to the price that I paid for it! It absolutely in my opinion allows you to carry your firearms covertly, and no one will be able to tell what is contained in the case. This is why I gave this case 5 stars across the board!
customer_reviews.author: midnightvision

customer_reviews.title: A well made case at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Case appears well built. Holds my Grand Power SP9 with brace fully extended (~25in) & there's plenty of room for my FN pistol. Adequate space in the pocket on the front for several mags & accessories. The case came with 6 velcro straps that are of great quality too. We'll see how it all holds up over time but for the price, it can't be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: How did this get passed quality control?
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this case 3 star because it came defective. It has a very obvious spot on the front left where the seam wasn't completely sewed up. I can't understand how this made it passed quality control? I will upload a picture when I get a chance but seriously frustrating because now I have to return and wait for another case. Other wise this is a very compact case with room for 6 mags, ar15 broken down into upper/lower and maybe a flash light but not much more.
customer_reviews.author: David Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what i intended.
customer_reviews.text: I am utilizing this case for a dpms ar-10 with a large scope and 24" barrel. I break it down in two sections and quick detach the bipod, all of it fits comfortably within the main compartment. In the secondary outside compartment i have two 20 round .308 mags and usually one of my pistols that will also fit in the mag pouches as well. All together everything weighs about 20 lbs, the case handles it well. I also like the material it is made from due to the fact that it does not collect fuzz and animal fur and other things that like to stick to black material.
customer_reviews.author: BKG

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive case
customer_reviews.text: It's really hard to beat the value this case offers for the money. The exterior pocket contains multiple pouches to hold magazines or accessories. The main compartment has adjustable straps to position whatever you are carrying so it won't move around in transit. I can fit a 20" AR disassembled or M4 assembled in the main compartment. The front of the case also offers a clear window for your business card just in case you want to ID or advertise. The zippers feel somewhat lightweight, but have held up to use so far. PROS: Inexpensive Well made Good interior organization CONS: Lightweight zippers
customer_reviews.author: mister2

customer_reviews.title: Good case for little dough
customer_reviews.text: Well thought out layout. Lots of heavy Velcro straps for holding your scattergun in place, but no straps for holding down the rifle in the side pouch (boo, hoo!). Pistol holster in the side pouch can take a full frame 1911 or an M9. It's even big enough for my .50 AE Deagle MK XIX, heh. Pouches for four 30 or 40 round rifle mags, and elastic straps for eight pistol mags. I'm really starting to like this UTG stuff. I was impressed with their low-cost optics that can stand up to 12 gauge recoil; now I'm getting more and more of their other accessories, and liking what I'm getting.
customer_reviews.author: Some Useless Geek

customer_reviews.title: Nice versatile bag
customer_reviews.text: I would wrire a review and take a picture to show the 34' bags versatility, but it has been covered. My only grip so far is that i wished the front pocket would unzip all the way, so that it would lay flat. When you unzip the main compartment it lays flat. Why not the front pocket? Oh well, it has not annoyed me enough yet to want to take a star away.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: I just bought a hardshell Plano case for a little more and love it. The UTG case is smaller so it ...
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. I used it as a takedown case for my over/under shotgun. Takes time to secure all the straps and after all that, the barrels and stock attach points sag under the weight and bang against each other so I have to put a pad between them. I just bought a hardshell Plano case for a little more and love it. The UTG case is smaller so it can be crammed into smaller areas but the Plano case is sooo much better. Buy the $15 case from walmart or buy something better IMO.
customer_reviews.author: J. Woodington

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and good quality
customer_reviews.text: This case is a perfect size for a braced AR pistol. It has a separate zippered compartment with sleeves for mags and the body of the bag has adjustable velcro tie downs to hold the pistol securely in place. Quality (zippers, sewn seams, etc) seems quite good.
customer_reviews.author: RRuebs

customer_reviews.title: Still great after 5yrs
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this item since Feb 2011, which I bought from Amazon. It works great to carry my AR-15, 6 full magazines, my XDm 9mm (it's 2 magazines), two boxes of 9mm, and a couple tools. It has held up great! And although I don't recommend putting a hot rifle away, I have done so many times.
customer_reviews.author: TheVirg

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, verify your size before ordering
customer_reviews.text: I ended up accidentally ordering the small one, which was a little too short to fit my 16" upper with compensator (I could have fit it with thread protector). I ended up using for multiple handguns, which worked better than several individual cases. Nicely made, good padding. Opens flat, and makes nice table pad when open. Can't speak to durability yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jon from Central CA

customer_reviews.title: Inconspicuous Case - Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Very low profile case, I can carry this around most places and the only people who have commented as what instrument I play. My only gripe is that I wish there was a little more padding - the way my AR straps in best leaves the red dot pushed against the bottom of the bag so I need to be careful when setting it down. Overall it's a nice bag. PS - Don't buy UTG's 3x magnifier, though!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Stone

customer_reviews.title: Not the most protective/durable case out there, but it'll do the job for your range trips
customer_reviews.text: The zippers on this case don't feel especially durable...and the padding isn't super thick (the reasons I took away 1 star), but if your planned use is transporting a smallish firearm (CZ Scorpion EVO SBR in my case) that isn't exceptionally thick, this is a good case and a good value. I would order another one if I had another similarly sized firearm.
customer_reviews.author: jekbrown

customer_reviews.title: I do however like it and it just fit my Hi Point 9mm ...
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 5 stars if it had just a bit more padding. I do however like it and it just fit my Hi Point 9mm Carbine rifle and has the second compartment for the magazines, accessories and whatever you wish ( even a couple of handguns). Seeing the Hi Point is heavy, this feels a bit flimsy for any real protection past dust, spills, someone sneezing, or general handy to carry. Thus, for those reasons it is worth the price and is a very good carry case to range. Lighter weight guns will see more bragging rights.
customer_reviews.author: Lee T. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Nice Case
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a new AR. I'm certainly glad I read previous reviews on the sizing. Anything below 34 inches for an AR will be too small. With the stock fully collapsed 34" fits perfectly. Plus I like the separate storage for magazines which I used all of them. Zipping up the ends takes a bit of positioning but not a big deal. I'm happy with the case and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Go Dawgs

customer_reviews.title: I think it is a very good case. I am giving it four starts as ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I think it is a very good case. I am giving it four starts as I had to return/replace the first one because the zipper broke. There seems to be a quality control issue with the zipper as stated by other reviewers. Otherwise, I would buy it again. I like the fact that it doesn't "look" like a gun case but more of a large carry bag.
customer_reviews.author: rchrpwin15

customer_reviews.title: Decent case for the mony
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent case for the money. I bought it hoping it would hold my 10/22 and Walther MP5SD. It would but the fit was really tight with a good possibility that the two would rub together so I decided to just use it for the 10/22 and get a 32 " one for the Walther. It comes with eight 1 1/2 " x 12 " heavy duty Velcro straps for securing the weapon, and holds my 10/22 nice and secure. The roomy outside pouch has three mag pouches and a built in hand gun holster that looks like it would hold a large frame auto. Seems to be well constructed using good quality materials.
customer_reviews.author: RCM

customer_reviews.title: Great tactical rifle case
customer_reviews.text: Very nice case. Well made and perfectly fits one M4 with bipod and accessories. The description says it is made for two rifles but with optics it only fits one. The style does not scream firearm inside and the quality of the surface material feels more like a laptop case. The inside has various loop fasteners that secures your rifle snugly. The price was great and overall very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JamesN808

customer_reviews.title: Protective case, not truly covert.
customer_reviews.text: Holds an AR carbine with collapsed stock and optics with inserted magazine. Magazine pouches hold loaded mags in place for transport. Not sure how covert it is. Everyone I showed it to knew what it was as soon as they saw it. Does not change the fact that it protects the weapon for transport. Nice at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Beckey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!! I found vintage Savage 24d in great ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect!! I found vintage Savage 24d in great condition and needed a case that would protect it and carry it in take down condition. The 24" case fits the firearm just fine Has two sets of Velcro tie straps that secure everything well. The top pocket has plenty of room for ammo and other gear. It's very discrete and doesn't scream gun..well made product! It's not a go to the range every week product but it didn't cost $100 either.
customer_reviews.author: Southguy

customer_reviews.title: Great case!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased a second case. It holds my PS-90 with room to spare. It will also fits my KSG or Scorpion Evo carbine (folded).No..not at the same time, but individually. All have optics installed and there is plenty of room. Separate zippered section for mags is well thought out and sufficient. Quality is great considering the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: I don't give anything a perfect 5 start
customer_reviews.text: I don't give anything a perfect 5 start, so that should tell you something. I got this bag because it was reasonably priced and got great reviews. I see why now. It is very well made, kind of sleek for being a large case, and just "handles" well. It can fit two rifles, a pistol or two and lots of magazines. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hay

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: I like this case a lot. Pretty inconspicuous and has a surprising amount of room inside. Great for taking a few pistols or a short AR pistol to the range. Use it all the time. Feel free to ask any questions or let me know if any specific pictures would help. Please let me know if you found this review helpful.
customer_reviews.author: POWERPRO

customer_reviews.title: The case seems to be quite well made and the zipper appears to be a good one. It fits very well
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to hold a new model Ruger Charger with a 2 inch linear compensator on the barrel. The case seems to be quite well made and the zipper appears to be a good one. It fits very well, holding the gun with a fairly large scope mounted, a small 90 degree rail sticking out on the left side, and Ruger BX-25 magazine installed. It also holds 2 BX-25x2 magazines in the main compartment. The bipod and a flashlight/laser module go into the front pocket, which could hold much more. I'd give the case a 10 out of 10.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Would be even better if it didn't come in scary gun black
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a Bulldog, inconspicuous case, but it just didn't have the features this has. Lots of straps inside, big outside pockets holds many mags and other stuff. My AR 10.5 pistol, broke down with mag in main compartment has plenty of room, a 7.5 would probably fit unbroken. Would be even better if it didn't come in scary gun black, maybe art student portfolio material or color, no one would ever want to look in or take one of those.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: It's a great case for the $
customer_reviews.text: This gun case is awesome. Very adjustable as far as the velcro straps for securing an AR rifle or pistol. The quality seems pretty good. The stitching looks consistent and everything looked even and well done. The zippers are nice as well as the backpack straps.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Overall this is a good case, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a good case, especially for the price. Seems well made and durable. My biggest complaint is that the case is thin. A standard AR with an Eotech sight proved a little on the thick side when fitted into this case. It does function well, and it has a ton of Velcro stapes in the case that can be positioned to fit almost anything. The outside zipper pouch gives you room for carrying magazines, but it not suited for much else, seems a little overdone. Comes with both a shoulder strap and carry handle.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Description says it fits 2 scoped rifles.  Nope.
customer_reviews.text: Should notice the pictures where it shows 2 rifles in the case. Neither have scopes. I have 5 AR15s and not even one can be strapped into the case with a scope on it. I also noticed that the larger sized cases still do not have the height needed to strap in 2 scoped rifles. I sent my 34" bag back. Going to shop for a not so covert case.
customer_reviews.author: RandyTF

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic budget case
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic budget case. Light weight and the webbing/Velcro inside allows for a lot of different configurations. also the elastic webbing in the front pouch is great for holding mags. Only issue is that the elastic tends to set if you put something large in there it will not fully bounce back. I would keep that in mind if you double stack mags in there you may not be able to use those slots for single mags in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Loudog

customer_reviews.title: 32 inch bag
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this bag for a couple weeks now. If your looking for a sleek and simple case then this is a good bag. The price of about 30 bucks is well worth it. I can see this bag lasting me for a longtime. But I am not going to use it rigorously. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: blake f

customer_reviews.title: Great case...maybe not so covert...
customer_reviews.text: What I like: Adjustable hook/loop straps inside hold my M70 very securely. Space for a lot of handgun clips, tac lights, and other small items. Good padding for rifles. Quality shoulder straps. Doesn't scream "assault rifle inside!", but you're not gonna fool "homeland security." What I'd like better: The case could be taller, I'm not sure if my Mossberg 500 will fit next to the AK without them clanking against one another. Will only hold 30 round clips, my 40's won't fit in the pockets. I'd like the handgun clip loops to be offset so I could carry more. The last is a matter of preference...my Ruger P95 doesn't fit well in the pistol compartment...I may get it re stitched.
customer_reviews.author: UnofficialPatrickSwayze

customer_reviews.title: Awesome case!
customer_reviews.text: Great case for my S&W M&P-15! My rifle is 32.5" collapsed, so I purchased the 34" and it fits perfectly. A lot of bands and straps for accessories. The overall quality of the case seems very high and durable. My only complaint, albeit a very small one, is that the front zippers do not go down the whole way (see picture) which makes the flap a little hard to stay open, but that's just me being picky. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JD K.

customer_reviews.title: Shopped around and glad I waited
customer_reviews.text: Great bag for the AR rifle with plenty of space for extra ammo, mags and range pistol. I have already recommended one to my brother. Did a lot of shopping before I bought - just what I was looking for. Wish only that the back straps could be tucked inside somehow when they were not being used. I have a Jansport bag that has this feature. Other than that - this is a great bag.
customer_reviews.author: dennis e.

customer_reviews.title: Ideal small case for M&P 15-22
customer_reviews.text: This case arrived well packed and very fast shipped from AMAZON as per usual. It is very well made as I have found most UTG products are, and I consider it well priced. Sturdy material and zippers that work, nicely padded and above all, well designed. The main compartment has elastic straps with sturdy velcro straps that can be positioned as needed. These hold my rifle sections securely. The accessories compartment holds my six magazines in three pockets with four elastic straps holding flashlight, monocular, bipod and green laser, perfect for the range. Yes, I like this product, recommend it as long as you measure your components to assure they will fit. Support the second amendment.
customer_reviews.author: D&D

customer_reviews.title: eh...its ok..
customer_reviews.text: i bought the 34 inch case.. and i could not load 2 ar pistols without damaging the finish on the them because there is not enough room. basically its only good for 1...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great case.
customer_reviews.text: Great case... the smaller pocket has a built in handgun holster as well as magazine pouches, the whole thing is very well made all the way down to the adjustable retention straps and backback straps... thumbs up to UTG again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Roger N.

customer_reviews.title: Great case, but there are a few issues
customer_reviews.text: Great case, but there are a few issues. If I could, I'd rate it a 3.5/5, rather than a 3/10. The main pocket zippers tend to get jammed up if you fully unzip the bag and/or aren't putting hand pressure on the bag while closing it. It feels fragile as a result, and I'm always worried that I'm going yank one side off and render the bag unusable. The admin pocket zippers do not wrap around the the base of the pocket, resulting in the flap not being capable of folding down. Not a major issue, but mildly annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewy McReviewface

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Too much space.
customer_reviews.text: Too big, but my expectations were misplaced. Good quality. Too much space. With 2 rifles and mags and a pistol, it’s more than 25lbs. Not practical.
customer_reviews.author: ioannis Spiropoulos

customer_reviews.title: Nice styling & quality
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Very nice bag. Actually got compliments when I walked into the firing range. If it’s my KelTech KS7 perfectly as well as other guns and accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for a KT Sub2000
customer_reviews.text: Fits the Kel Tek Sub2000 with lots of room to spare. The fully adjustable straps allow you to decide how/where you want to secure the gun. It has pockets for magazines and other range equipment. I shared a link to this item on a Kel Tek users group forum and a number of people bought one for themselves. One S2K owner was able to secure two S2K carbines by nesting them.
customer_reviews.author: Oak

customer_reviews.title: Great strong carry case
customer_reviews.text: Had an odor when it arrived, but it cleared up after a few days. the 32" bag perfectly fits my tavor w/ 16.5" barrel and optics on the top, with some room left in one corner for a handgun. The side pouch holds plenty of mags and has 3 main pockets and some elastic straps. Quality construction as well, the velcro rings are sturdy, zippers are good, and pouches are sturdy too.
customer_reviews.author: Ben W

customer_reviews.title: Good Bag for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive about ordering this bag, since it was so inexpensive. It has features of more expensive bags, and seems to be well made. I am not dissapointed!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L

customer_reviews.title: Nice Rifle and Gun case
customer_reviews.text: This is a great case to carry to the both for rifle and handguns, does enough room for both of'em i. It is very durable case for the price cannot be beat
customer_reviews.author: BigpapaBean

customer_reviews.title: Really great value
customer_reviews.text: This is a steal for the price. Works really well for my AR-9. Not the most well built item I’ve ever owned but unless you’re at the range every day it should last a good long while.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: OK but not great. 32" not really big enough for 2 scoped black carbines
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT come with shoulder strap as shown on package. Not enough room for 2 scoped rifles and needs to be 4" - 6" longer than firearm as it is not real roomy. Side pouch is OK for storing magazines but straps and pouches not big or stout enough to hold any pistol bigger than compact. Will keep but probably not buy again. Also, it is billed as being covert but has a big UTG badge sewed on. Time to get my razor blade out and get rid of t
customer_reviews.author: Fernwood

customer_reviews.title: Cost/Construction Good Value - Would Buy Again
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed and lots of loops inside to secure your weapon. Ample/adequate padding. Magazine case pockets have elastic to hold the magazines in firmly (inside the outer zipped pocket on front of bag). There is a carry strap sewn into the middle of the back of the carry case. Ergonomically, it should be on the top of the case parallel with the handle. For the price, this case is a good value and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Chessie Trotline

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: This case is too small in my opinion. I already have a UTG Deluxe Covert Homeland Security Gun Case which I should have bought again. 16 inch AR-10 collapsible stock does not fit. Saiga 12 collapsible stock does not fit. Pump with folding stock fits. 16 inch AR 15 collapsible stock fits. 9mm carbine fits. The case is still usable as you can break down an AR and it will fit. Spend the extra cash for a UTG Deluxe Covert Homeland Security Gun Case or UTG Elite Covert Homeland Security Gun Case.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas1963

customer_reviews.title: Perfect with a 16" barrel...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of them. Anyone that's bashing them because a full, assembled rifle won't fit in them is dumb. The bag can't manipulate matter to make a 28" rifle (or however long it is) fit into a 25" case. It's meant for removing the two take-down pins and putting the upper and lower in separately. I have also put the lower in the front pocket and the upper in the main pocket when my scope made the upper just a tiny bit too long to fit horizontally in the main compartment. I had to put it at an angle and run it from corner to corner. It still worked just fine. Buy it. You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Nay-man

customer_reviews.title: Great Complete Uppers Case
customer_reviews.text: This case is great. I am really using it to carry my "extra" complete uppers, pistols/mags and range accessories (holsters, ear protection, tools). Just improvise I always say.
customer_reviews.author: Cleon

product_meta.title: UTG Covert Homeland Security Gun Case with Adjustable Shoulder Strap and Logo
feature_bullets: Durable 600D Polyester Construction; Front Pocket with 4 Magazine Pouches and 6 Miscellaneous Elastic Loops
Versatile Design for Storing a Variety of Different Firearms; Padded Interior Provides Maximum Protection from Dents and Scratches
Fully Adjustable Hook-and-loop Retention Straps Keep Firearms Secure During Transportation
1.5 inch Wide Adjustable Padded Shoulder Strap for Hands Free Transportation
Durable 1.5 inch Wide Two-piece Wraparound Carry Handle for Immediate Grab and Go

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
